column2: Cooling wages for U.S. healthcare workers dim inflation outlook WASHINGTON
column3: July 8 Rising wages for U.S. healthcare workers had helped to drive a modest acceleration of inflation over the past year
column4: but these gains in earnings have slowed
column5: which could make it harder for the Federal Reserve to achieve its inflation target.

column2: UPDATE 3-Amgen drug appears 'highly similar' to Humira -FDA staff July 8 Amgen Inc's version of AbbVie Inc's Humira arthritis drug
column4: appears similar in potency and safety to the original product
column5: U.S. Food and Drug Administration staff members said on Friday.

column2: U.S. Air Force chief confident Boeing will fix KC-46A tanker issuesU.S. Air Force chief confident Boeing will fix KC-46A tanker issuesAIRSHOW-Farnborough faces fewer jet orders
column5: July 8 The aerospace industry is preparing to celebrate major milestones at the Farnborough Airshow next week as Boeing turns 100 and Canada's Bombardier marks the entry into service of a new jet designed to challenge the duopoly of Boeing and Airbus.  AIRSHOW-Farnborough faces fewer jet orders

AIDS Healthcare Foundation lawsuit over Gilead AIDS drugs dismissed A California federal judge has dismissed a lawsuit filed by the non-profit AIDS Healthcare Foundation challenging Gilead Sciences' patents on AIDS drugs and accusing it of suppressing competition.

column2: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Striking Wal-Mart workers in China return to work - for now SHANGHAI/CHICAGO
